text: Hi everyone - I am setting up the search results template on a portal and wondered if there is any hubl that I pick for these. Basically, when the results are listed out, the excerpts have different lenghts so I would like to add a "|truncate" filter for these but I can't find any reference. Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
The search results are retrieved and rendered with Javascript, so HubL won’t work. You can definitely clone the Search Results module and truncate the excerpt in JS

Any idea why my id which used to be
```hs_menu_wrapper_offscreen_menu```
is now
```hs_menu_wrapper_module_152943050464235_offscreen_menu```?
Not sure why it changed but all of my mobile menu js and styling was hinged on that id. It doesn’t seem to have happened on any of our other portals.
yea… fair warning avoid ever using HS class names and ID’s for anything unless you absolutely can’t avoid it
especially if you see a number in the ID that kinda indicates it could change
I thought I was safe because there was no number. All is lost.
We have custom rich text module that is in our blog template, but in the simple list view it returns a zero “0”, has anyone seen this before?

This was a recent change to incorporate the custom module name in the id of the of wrapper. This is how CMv1 modules worked before. Without it, it’s impossible to have unique ids when you have multiple instances of a module on a page
